answerText: human papilloma virus [or HPV][10] The HPV virus' E6 protein is responsible for inhibiting this tumor-suppressor gene, which is responsible for activating the transcription of p21 and arresting the cell cycle in response to DNA damage. It is named for its weight.
heading: ICCS |2014 | 10 | 21 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Gardasil is a vaccination against this virus, which can also cause recurrent respiratory papillomatosis.  [10] Name this virus which is responsible for most cases of cervical cancer.
